parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The unintended gear shifting can cause the motorcycle to suddenly lose power, leading to a loss of control, accidents, or near-miss situations, especially when merging into traffic or cornering.
symptoms: The transmission shifts unexpectedly
often between 4th and 5th gear
causing the motorcycle to jerk or lurch
the engine to rev freely
or the rear tire to lock up temporarily. The shifting may be accompanied by loud clunking or clunkety-clunk sounds.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Transmission Component Failure: Bent Shift Forks
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The bent shift forks can cause the transmission to malfunction, leading to unintended gear shifting, loss of power, and potential accidents.
symptoms: The transmission shifts erratically
often with a ratcheting or clunking sound
and may jump out of gear or into neutral without warning.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of clutch components can cause the transmission to malfunction, leading to unintended gear shifting, loss of power, and potential accidents.
symptoms: The clutch may feel soft or spongy
and the transmission may shift erratically or unexpectedly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The low-speed front end wobble can cause loss of control, accidents, and potentially lead to injuries or fatalities, especially at speeds below 45 mph.
symptoms: The front end of the motorcycle wobbles or shakes when decelerating or traveling at low speeds (around 30-45 mph)
making it difficult to control the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The rear brake shudder/lock-up can cause loss of control, increased stopping distance, and accidents, potentially leading to injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Violent shudder from the rear brake
entire motorcycle shakes noticeably
braking distance increases dramatically
shudder occurs during rear brake activation and does not stop regardless of front brake activation
shudder sometimes stops after releasing and re-applying the rear brake or returns directly upon rear brake application.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The front fork wobble/handlebar wobble ("head shake") can cause loss of control, making the motorcycle very unsafe, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The front end of the motorcycle wobbles at low and high speeds
the handlebars shake or wobble
the motorcycle becomes difficult to control
premature wear on the front tire.
